item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, December 13, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Exotic new superconductors delight and confound (54 points | 9 comments)
2. Show HN: @smoores/epub, a JavaScript library for working with EPUB publications (25 points | 11 comments)
3. The Pentium FDIV bug, reverse-engineered (31 points | 3 comments)
4. Making my first robot as a software engineer (134 points | 14 comments)
5. Show HN: Imposter Attack – Among Us-themed infrared game made with ESP32 (107 points | 20 comments)
6. Web Origami, for making websites where you can understand how they're made (132 points | 33 comments)
7. MarkItDown: Python tool for converting files and office documents to Markdown (149 points | 37 comments)
8. Noninvasive imaging method can penetrate deeper into living tissue (132 points | 14 comments)
9. "All your base are belong to us" intro to my 2004 MIT Spam Conference talk (26 points | 10 comments)
10. An Italian town that built its own sun (2021) (41 points | 14 comments)
11. Donald Bitzer has died (130 points | 13 comments)
12. Ask HN: What should I do with meet.hn? (83 points | 62 comments)
13. Animals in Espionage (16 points | 4 comments)
14. HyperDX (YC S22) is hiring engineers to build open source observability ( | hide)
15. 0x01 – Killing Windows Kernel Mitigations (32 points | 3 comments)
16. Elon Musk wanted an OpenAI for-profit (124 points | 112 comments)
17. SCCS roach motel (8 points | 1 comment)
18. Show HN: Rain hashes – well designed, simple and fast variable sized hashes (61 points | 18 comments)
19. Bit-permuting 16 u32s at once with AVX-512 (18 points | discuss)
20. Garbage collected smart pointers in Rust via concurrent cycle collection (81 points | 40 comments)
21. Test (331 points | 77 comments)
22. Evaporograph and Infra Red Images (8 points | discuss)
23. NASA believes it understands why Ingenuity crashed on Mars (26 points | 6 comments)
24. Three mistakes from Dart/Flutter's weak PRNG (60 points | 64 comments)
25. People who are good at reading have different brains: study (81 points | 66 comments)
26. The Errors of TeX [pdf] (1989) (11 points | discuss)
27. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it’s going (362 points | 183 comments)
28. A new video captures a 1968 demo of IBM’s Executive Terminal (303 points | 80 comments)
29. Internal Ocean Tides (2021) (14 points | 2 comments)
30. Hexagonal Architecture and Rails (10 points | discuss)
